context: Tonsillectomy. Tonsillitis. McIvor mouth gag was placed in the oral cavity and a tongue depressor applied.
The patient was taken to the operating room and prepped and draped in the usual fashion.
he McIvor mouth gag was placed in the oral cavity and a tongue depressor applied.

Two #12-French red rubber Robinson catheters were placed, 1 in each nasal passage, and brought out through the oral cavity and clamped over a dental gauze roll on the upper lip to provide soft palate retraction.
The nasopharynx was inspected with the laryngeal mirror.
The anterior tonsillar pillar was infiltrated with 1.5 cc of 1% Xylocaine with 1:100,000 epinephrine, as was the left tonsillar pillar.
The right tonsil was grasped with the tenaculum and retracted out of its fossa. By a similar procedure, the opposite tonsillectomy was performed and the fossa was packed

The right tonsil was grasped with the tenaculum and retracted out of its fossa. The anterior tonsillar pillar was incised with the #12 knife blade. The plica semilunaris was incised with the Metzenbaum scissors.

The tonsil was removed from the fossa and the fossa packed with a cherry gauze sponge as previously described. By a similar procedure, the opposite tonsillectomy was performed and the fossa was packed.

The tonsil was removed from the fossa and the fossa packed with a cherry gauze sponge as previously described. By a similar procedure, the opposite tonsillectomy was performed and the fossa was packed.
The pack was removed and bleeding was controlled with the suction Bovie unit. Bleeding was then similarly controlled in the left tonsillar fossa and the nasopharynx after removal of the packs.
The nasal passages and oropharynx were suctioned free of debris.
The patient tolerated the procedure well and left the operating room in good condition.
